result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffery Lee Saari

records.addlTxt: Initial Appearance set for 02/13/23 @ 1:15 p.m. in Br 1
Initial Appearance set for 11/21/22 @ 1:45 p.m. in Br 1

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.

1:21 PM Defendant Jeffery L Saari appeared by video, in custody.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of WI.
Attorney (Atty) Taylor Soule appears on behalf of the defendant.
ADA Dodge states facts for anticipated charges of Possession of Narcotic drugs and Bail Jumping. 
Attorney for the defendant does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Defendant   is  eligible for public defender representation.
Court questions defendant. ( his address confirmed by the court is 9823 STH 22, Waupaca, WI 54981)
State requests a signature bond with conditions as stated. 
Attorney for the defendant does not have any objections as to bond.
Hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
